action.action-desc: Mr. MacArthur (for himself, Ms. Esty of Connecticut, Mr. Foster, and Mr. Carson of Indiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to allow for the deferment of certain student loans during a period in which a borrower is enrolled in a drug treatment program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the College Loan Deferment for Recovery Act.

section.header: Student loan deferment for borrowers enrolled in a drug treatment program

subsection.text: Section 455(f) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087e(f)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as paragraphs (4) and (5), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:

paragraph.header: Deferment for borrowers enrolled in a drug treatment program

subparagraph.text: A borrower of a loan made under this part who meets the requirements of subparagraph (B) shall be eligible for a deferment, during which periodic installments of principal need not be paid, and interest shall not accrue.
A borrower of a loan made under this part shall be eligible for a deferment during—

clause.text: any period in which such borrower is enrolled in a drug treatment program; and

subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, the term drug treatment program means a program certified or licensed by a State to provide drug treatment in the State.
This paragraph shall apply with respect to loans—

clause.text: made on or after the date of the enactment of this paragraph; or
in repayment on the date of the enactment of this paragraph.

subsection.header: Terms of Federally Insured Student Loans
subsection.text: Section 427(a)(2)(C) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1077(a)(2)(C)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (iii), by inserting or after the semicolon; and
by inserting after clause (iii) the following:

clause.text: in which the borrower is enrolled in a drug treatment program (as defined in section 455(f)(3)(C)), and the 30 days after such period.

subsection.text: Section 428(b)(1)(M) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1078(b)(1)(M)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking or (II); or and inserting or (II);;
in clause (iv), by inserting or after the semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: during which the borrower is enrolled in a drug treatment program (as defined in section 455(f)(3)(C)), and the 30 days after such period;

subsection.text: Section 464(c)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087dd(c)(2)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (iv), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (v), by inserting or after the semicolon; and
by inserting after clause (v) the following:

clause.text: during which the borrower is enrolled in a drug treatment program (as defined in section 455(f)(3)(C)), and the 30 days after such period;

subsection.text: Section 428H(e)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1078–8(e)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking Interest and inserting, Except as provided in subparagraph (C), interest; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Interest shall not accrue on a loan deferred under section 428(b)(1)(M)(v) or 427(a)(2)(C)(iv).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to loans—

paragraph.text: made on or after the date of the enactment of this Act; or
in repayment on the date of the enactment of this Act.
